titleStmt.title: The Alcoran of Mahomet, translated out of Arabick into French, by the Sieur Du Ryer, Lord of Malezair, and resident for the French king, at Alexandria. And newly Englished, for the satisfaction of all that desire to look into the Turkish vanities. To which is prefixed, the life of Mahomet, the prophet of the Turks, and author of the Alcoran. With A needful caveat, or admonition, for them who desire to know what use may be made of, or if there be danger in reading the Alcoran.
Koran. English. 1649.
titleStmt.author: Du Ryer, André, ca. 1580-ca. 1660.
Ross, Alexander, 1591-1654. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: printed, and are to be sold by Randal Taylor, near Stationers Hall,

notesStmt.note: 'A needful caveat' is by Alexander Ross.
